thread.title: The I.C.S. Bill.

author: tribuneindia.com
title: The I.C.S. Bill.
text: WITH regard to the Indian Civil Service Temporary Provisions Bill it now transpires that although the Government of India were in a way consulted the text of the Bill has not as yet been received by them. This is highly unsatisfactory and ought to be protested against. The India Office, whenever it suits its purpose, points to the opinion of the Government of India as being opposed to a popular measure. Quite recently the Tory Lords in the Upper House went to the extent of exalting the opinion of the minority of the Viceroy's Executive Council. But here we have an instance in which the Government of India appear to have been practically ignored. The Bill affects most vitally the interests of the people of the country. The Government of India are fully aware of the long and arduous fight which Mr. Dadabhai Naoroji kept up throughout his long and honourable career to secure for his countrymen freer admissions to the I.C.S.
